intro: Kotschya oubanguiensis, commonly known as the Oubangui kotschya, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing habit, with slender stems that often root at the nodes. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and typically appear in clusters. Although not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
